intro: Malvastrum sajamense, commonly known as the Sajamense mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the warm, humid climate of its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
